newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Thai Bangchak refinery running at normal capacity.
newsitem.headline: Thai Bangchak refinery running at normal capacity.

text.p: The 120,000 barrels-per-day Bangchak Petroleum Plc refinery in Thailand is running at 100 percent despite reported worries about weak refinery margins in the country.
Adul Leelapatranurak, executive director of Petroleum Authourity of Thailand (PTT) said on Wednesday he expected Thailand's refineries to cut production to optimise profits because of weak margins.
He was speaking to Reuter on the sidelines of a downstream energy conference in Singapore.
Bangchak sources said on Thursday they were maintaining production at close to 120,000 bpd.
"We are running at normal capacity," one source said.
He said primary margins for the refinery were weak but still positive. Some Singapore refiners said primary margins in Singapore were negative.
The Bangchak source said the refinery did not have any plans for now to cut runs in the next two months.
The refinery is geared to sales to the domestic Thai market, exporting only modest amounts of gasoline.
